fields.description:
The first one or two reviews are rendered as permaID only, with hover. If there are more than two, we get "More Reviews" and click to get a list of the others as a popup, with permaID and title. 

1. "More Reviews" -> "and others...", and in a smaller font, to match the changeset info immediately to the left
2. show a truncated, single line title always, even for the first two reviews.
3. enable hover in the popup list of reviews (depends on CRUC-3064 being fixed first)
fields.summary: Fix display of assoicated reviews on changeset page

fields.description: reviewLinkTag is buggy in that you can supply linkText="foo" and hoverable="true" and hovers will break. Redo the underlying crulinkspan to use a similar mechanism as the changeset hovers (hidden input field containing review permaid rather than assuming link text is the permaid).
fields.summary: reviewLink.tag is buggy

fields.description:
Review events are emitted and any plugin listeners are notified. The various plugin event listeners handle the event synchronously, before returning to the user who triggered the event (ie after a state change, during creation etc). Not a problem for small reviews. Large reviews can cause everything including plugin events to take a long time.

This has the potential such that plugin event based actions can slow down crucible as a whole.
fields.summary: Plugin event handlers should be notified asynchronously.

fields.description: I can't disable the option in either fisheye or crucible
fields.summary: Can't disable "Ignore blank lines"

fields.description:
The new side-by-side diff only supports full context and doesn't not support soft-wrapping.

These sections in the diff options menu should all be disabled with the tick always next to 'Full Context' and 'No Wrapping' (see attached image).
fields.summary: Unavailable diff options aren't disabled in side-by-side diff
Replace 3D close icons and add a close to the filter dialogue

fields.description:
there have been a few support cases where using the In Built rules *with* custom rules is causing bugs.

they should be able to be used together, as in any custom rules are just added on to the inbuilt ones. 

we either need to find out what the problem is and fix it, or force users to choose between custom and inbuilt. there is a warning in the doco saying you should only have one or the other, but the UI doesnt enforce it. http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/diffpages.action?originalId=197297681&pageId=203396103
fields.summary: fix svn symbolic rules

fields.description:
In Fisheye/Crucible Administration, go to the "Project List", find any existing project (or create one) and then look to the right-most column ("Edit FishEye Content") and select the "view/edit" link.

This screen appears to associate module+paths with the project.
Unfortunately, although the information is stored and retained, 
it appears to have no discernible effect and does not seem to be accessible via the crucible API.

If I could access this information via the crucible API, I could use it to improve the review creator plugin.  Since we have more than one project per module, it would be an advantage in automatic review creation to be able to determine whether a given commit contained any files in a path considered to be part of a given project. 

Currently there is no documentation available for this page/feature.

Please document what it is supposed to do.

Also please make the path information accessible to plugins via the crucible API 
(likely hanging somehow off com.atlassian.crucible.spi.data.ProjectData)
fields.summary: Document and make accessible the Crucible Project paths

fields.description:
add a file tree for each patch? / remove checkboxes

we need to keep in mind going to iterative patch reviews, and how the UI will be affected before we jump in and implement for example file trees. also how to represent that for anchored patches, there are (potentially) 2 revisions per patch file

fields.description:
Returning 200 when using an incorrect username and/or password is just not right:

{noformat}
$ curl -v -u incorrect:credentials "https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/rest-service/reviews-v1" 
* Server auth using Basic with user 'incorrect'
> GET /crucible/rest-service/reviews-v1 HTTP/1.1
> Authorization: Basic aW5jb3JyZWN0OmNyZWRlbnRpYWxz
> User-Agent: curl/7.19.7 (i386-apple-darwin9.8.0) libcurl/7.19.7 OpenSSL/0.9.8l zlib/1.2.3
> Host: extranet.atlassian.com
> Accept: */*
> 
< HTTP/1.1 200 OK
< Date: Sun, 31 Jan 2010 23:55:11 GMT
< Server: Jetty(6.1.16)
< Content-Type: application/xml
< Last-Modified: Sun, 31 Jan 2010 23:54:54 GMT
< ETag: "1264982094949-28036"
< Vary: Accept-Encoding
< Transfer-Encoding: chunked
< 
<?xml version='1.0' encoding='UTF-8'?><reviews />
{noformat}

This was also raised in the forums: [http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257330712]

Note that this issue is related to CRUC-1452
fields.summary: REST should return a 401 when using invalid basic http credentials instead of falling back to anonymous

fields.description:
Lets say the developper creates a Pre-commit review on half the files he have modified.

When the number of files is big, we loose a lot of time to re-choosing the files for check-in.

Crucible plugin already knows all those files, there should be an option to bring the Commit popup with all the files that was in the review already selected.
fields.summary: Pre-commit summarise should popup the commit window with all files reviewed.

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Use a query like: 

{code}
select revisions from dir /path/to/dir/ where is head and path like fileX and not in review Review
{code}

# make sure the latest revision of fileX is not in reviewX 
# make sure some other revision of fileX is in reviewX
# the query should return the latest revision of fileX
# now add the latest revision of fileX to the review. 
# refresh the query and fileX should not be returned
# remove all other revisions of fileX from the review, excluding head
# now the query will return the latest revision of fileX again, which is {color:red}incorrect{color}.

Reported via atlassian forums: http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257330673
fields.summary: EyeQl incorrectly views revisions as unreviewed when only one revision of a file is included in a review.

fields.description:
When we create a pre-commit review, the files added in the pre-commit are not added to the Mylyn task context by default.

The context stay completelly empty.

Even if you right click the task->context-> all menu item are grayed out.
fields.summary: Pre-commit files are not added to the Context by default.

fields.description:
Such replies added by REST API are then non-editable (only deletable) from web UI.

See - e.g. https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/cru/CR-PLE-206 which demonstrates this problem.

POST at <base URL>/rest-service/reviews-v1/<review perma id>/comments/<comment perma id> with the comment data indicating the draft, should be rejected.
fields.summary: REST API allows to publish non-draft replies (while updating them via POST) to draft comment

fields.description:
Created by Nicolas Venegas from Seb Ruiz's Crucible comment on sbs-diff.js line 750 https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-3015#c27058 :

We highlight the current line always in annotation view ([example|https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/browse/FE/trunk/src/content/static/2static/script/fe/sbs-diff.js?r=53247#l32]). We should do the same here.
fields.summary: Highlight the current line in side-by-side diff - the anchored line.

fields.description: While the remove file x is grayed out, the remove revision x in the header is not, so an error box appears when you try to remove the revision.
fields.summary: Revisions with comments don't have delete x disabled

fields.description:
On a pre-commit review, we need a way to make it iterative.

Here is a common scenario:

1) The developper creates a Pre-commit review
2) The Reviewer insert a comment in a file to adjust something in the code
3) The developper gets notified, and makes the correction.

Now, how this developper sends then update to Crucible so the reviewer can
get notified and complete the review?

Right now, we can click the "Add a patch from workspace changes to the Review."

The problem is that it duplicates the file in the review, wich can become very
unreadable on multiple files review/multiple comments and changes.

There should be a way to group the same  files together and show only the latest one in the review window, with something like a [+] on left to expand and see other versions.
fields.summary: Iterative pre-commit reviews

fields.description:
When creating a review with the default permission scheme, if there is no default moderator and the user specifies a moderator that is not the user themself then they cannot start the review from the review popup - namely, because the button should change to be a "send to moderator" button instead of a start button. Currently the start button remains and when the reviewer clicks on it, an annoying little error box pops up and breaks their workflow. 

Similarly, if there is a default moderator and the user changes the moderator to the reviewer themself they should be able to then start the review from the same review dialog.

This is related to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3143
fields.summary: Choosing a moderator that isn't the logged in user breaks the review workflow

fields.description: We need to rebuild the quicknav index when a repository is reindexed, and when we change the format of the data recorded in the index.
fields.summary: Rebuild Quicknav index at 'appropriate' times

fields.description: ChangesetIndexer and QuickNavChangesetIndexer need to batch the Lucene operations so that they don't run out of memory.
fields.summary: Batch updates to Lucene changeset index

fields.description:
Customer's description:

{quote}
We use Lotus Notes and throughout our software we can link to lotus notes documents using the 'notes' protocol in a URL.
sample URL: notes://dominoPro/xe54/ActionList2.nsf/0/729B71846F4EC6EFC12576AF0031124E
In confluence we can successfully use this as a link, but in Fisheye/Crucible this doesn't seem to work.

sample confluence link: [Click to open LotusNotes document|notes://dominoPro/xe54/ActionList2.nsf/0/729B71846F4EC6EFC12576AF0031124E]
{quote}
fields.summary: CLONE -Cannot create notes:// hyperlinks using WIKI renderer

fields.summary: I get this in my Crucible logs org.xml.sax.SAXNotRecognizedException

fields.description:
In eclipse,

Create a Pre-commit review. 

Dont add a reviewer yet. Start the review.

Add a reviewer.

This reviewer is never notified of the review via email.

This is kinda critical if the developper forget to put the reviewer and the "start review immediatelly" is enabled.

This should be really easy to fix also. Since when the review is started with a reviewer he is notified correctly.
fields.summary: Reviewer not notified when added after Review is started via Eclipse

fields.description:
Just noticed that Crucible fails to give changes through REST API for some repositories.

Check:https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/rest-service/repositories-v1/changes/atlassian/ fails with Crucible SCM repository "atlassian" not found.

But https://atlaseye.atlassian.com/rest-service/repositories-v1/changes/officeconnector/ works without problems.

It seems that all SCM repositories managed by plug-ins return changes, but it fails for embedded SCM providers.
fields.summary: Changes are returned only for plugabble repositories
Fix white space and alignment issues in IE
Remove branch, tag and author fields from the add content to review, search header, as they appear to be unused and duplicate search fields

fields.description:
As JIRA bundles the FishEye JIRA plugin and the View Issue page ion JIRA got a total rewrite the plugin needs to be updates such that it does not look out of place.

We have a HTML/CSS guru from JIRA to work with us on this starting around 3rd February 2010. Needs to be done that week.
fields.summary: Update the JIRA FishEye plugin to comply with the new JIRA 4.1 View Issue look and feel

fields.description:
Reviewing Confluence documents is a powerful feature in the Atlassian suite but in its current form it really can only be used by those who can understand wiki text.  There are several improvements that could be made in order to make Confluence document review accessible to Confluence users who use the Rich Text editor.

* Add ability to view diffs/comment on rendered content in addition to diffs in the wiki text.
* Add integration of review functionality already in Confluence with Crucible assuming that both products are present. (linked issue has some ideas but that integration can go deeper).  I'll refrain from designing this but I'll say that the integration in its current form is not incredibly usable by anyone other than a developer due to the complexity of adding items into a review and keeping them up to date.
** Add hooks into Confluence to update active Crucible reviews with the latest published version of a file.  This is possible and done often for other SCM e.g. SVN hooks.
** Add ability to get at Crucible reviews of content from that content in Confluence.  At the very least, active reviews.
fields.summary: Improvements to Confluence document review

fields.description: class is "quick-search-user"
fields.summary: Create css style with icon for users/committers found in quicknav
Handle loading two blocks when displaying a block boundary

fields.description: via https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-3013#c26981
fields.summary: Move/merge old CSS files into 2static
FishEye won't start on Solaris

fields.description: I would like to be able to mark comments as "to be reviewed".   During our review process we sometimes get a lot of comments in the review that do not need to be discussed in the wrap-up meeting.  Having the ability to add different custom fields or meta-data to the comments would be useful.  We could probably use the current defect fields if you could filter by type of defect and a comment could be marked as defect by someone other than the first author.
fields.summary: Additional filter/custom fields for comments

fields.description: If you type a string into the quicknav box from a global context, no dropdown appears, and a javascript error is raised
fields.summary: Global quicknav produces js error

fields.description: At present there is no way for a plugin to determine which groups a user is a member of. We need to add this and other UserManager methods to UserService.
fields.summary: Add group related methods to UserService

fields.description:
Our [suppored platforms matrix|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Supported+Platforms] indicates that Safari 4 is a supported browser (no mention is made to Safari 3). FishEye and crucible are both severely broken in Safari 3 (see screenshots). We should either put the effort into fixing the app (I would estimate a day or twos work), or explicitly mention that the browser isn't supported, and put an alert in the app similar to what we do with IE6.

FWIW Jira also seems fucked with safari 3 (can't preview the wiki renderer)
fields.summary: Safari 3 isn't supported, but pretends to be

fields.description:
currently it will say a url is invalid given something like
td://nafs.nafs.qualitycenter/qcbin/Defects?Action=FindDefect&DefectID=9549

in this situation http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257291048&tstart=0#257291048 , the user knows that all users will have browsers compatible with td://

so, either make it easier to modify the validation, or as Niels suggests, add a "i know what im doing, trust me" checkbox.
fields.summary: relax url validation in the linker

fields.description: The class is quick-search-project and the style should be analogous to quick-search-review etc.
fields.summary: Create css style with icon for projects found in quicknav

fields.description:
Questions raised in the original review needed addressing but weren't related to the code in the review as such.

Here's what I am to do:
1) Moved from non standard defaultValue attribute to jQuery data holder,
2) Rationalise code to one copy across the sites,
3) Remove redundant code, and
4) Only call the method when its required
fields.summary: CLONE -Trim spaces from changeset ids entered in 'scroll to changeset' box
